citation.article-title: Defluvicoccus vanus gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel Gram-negative coccus/coccobacillus in the 'Alphaproteobacteria' from activated sludge
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Defluvicoccus [De.flu.vi.coc′cus. L. neut. n. defluvium sewage; N.L. (Gr. derived) masc. n. coccus berry (spherical microbe); N.L. masc. n. Defluvicoccus a coccus from sewage].
Produces mucoid beige colonies <5 mm in diameter after 3–4 weeks incubation at 25 °C on GS medium.
Gram-negative, chemoheterotrophic, non-spore-forming, non-motile and aerobic cocci/coccobacilli (mean cell diameter 1·5–4·0 μm), which are usually arranged in clusters or tetrads.
Cells stain very faintly and appear empty after staining.
The type species is Defluvicoccus vanus.
